content: Nice blog. I took compiler construction as an undergrad and again in graduate school, because the class was so fun. I used the same text book, known as the “Dragon” book back then. This was back in the 1980s, and I don’t know if the book is still in use. The two instructors took two completely different approaches in both classes. I wrote a Domain Specific Languages for work several years ago. It was a load of fun. You should look in to the Interpreter Design Pattern as well as the Visitor Design Pattern for some ideas of how to approach Pinecone.
